channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How land-loving iguanas from North America may have ended up in Fiji
item.description: A new study suggests iguanas reached Fiji by rafting around 5,000 miles from North America.
item.content:encoded:
A new study suggests iguanas reached Fiji by rafting around 5,000 miles from North America.

(Image credit: The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Can you look at these 9 photos and not smile on International Day of Happiness?
item.description: March 20 is International Happiness Day — a day that the United Nations had dedicated to the celebration of joy. We asked photographers around the world to share a picture that can bring bliss.
item.content:encoded:
March 20 is International Happiness Day — a day that the United Nations had dedicated to the celebration of joy. We asked photographers around the world to share a picture that can bring bliss.

(Image credit: Andre Malerba / The Everyday Projects)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: Ex-F1 team owner and media personality Eddie Jordan has died at 76
item.description: Jordan ran his own team in the 1990s and 2000s in Formula 1. He became a popular pundit on TV after selling the team in 2005.
item.content:encoded:
Jordan ran his own team in the 1990s and 2000s in Formula 1. He became a popular pundit on TV after selling the team in 2005.

(Image credit: Alexander Zemlianichenko Jr)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Beauty from the ashes.' Texas Panhandle recovering one year after the state's largest wildfire
item.description: The Smokehouse Creek fire tore through the Texas Panhandle early last year, burning over a million acres in just weeks. In the small town of Canadian, where the devastation was severe, residents say the heartbreak lingers and a full recovery could take years.
item.content:encoded:
The Smokehouse Creek fire tore through the Texas Panhandle early last year, burning over a million acres in just weeks. In the small town of Canadian, where the devastation was severe, residents say the heartbreak lingers and a full recovery could take years.

(Image credit: Rachel Osier Lindley)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Osier Lindley

item.title: From TV to CMS: How Dr. Oz could shape Medicare and Medicaid
item.description: Dr. Oz lacks policy experience but has TV show chops. Tom Scully, who led Medicare & Medicaid for President George W. Bush, argues that Oz is well-suited to be a spokesman for Trump's health care agenda.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Oz lacks policy experience but has TV show chops. Tom Scully, who led Medicare & Medicaid for President George W. Bush, argues that Oz is well-suited to be a spokesman for Trump's health care agenda.

(Image credit: Craig Hudson/The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Levi

item.title: The Fed holds interest rates. And, judge denies request to block DOGE's USIP takeover
item.description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady yesterday as concerns loom over President Trump's new tariffs. And, a judge denied a request to block DOGE's takeover of the U.S. Institute of Peace.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady yesterday as concerns loom over President Trump's new tariffs. And, a judge denied a request to block DOGE's takeover of the U.S. Institute of Peace.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: New 'baby pictures' of the cosmos show the universe in its infancy
item.description: If our 13.8 billion-year-old cosmos could be considered middle-aged, researchers note these new images captured around its 380,000th birthday represent a snapshot of the universe as a newborn.
item.content:encoded:
If our 13.8 billion-year-old cosmos could be considered middle-aged, researchers note these new images captured around its 380,000th birthday represent a snapshot of the universe as a newborn.

(Image credit: ACT Collaboration; ESA / Planck Collaboration)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: How well do you know your March Madness trivia? Take our quiz
item.description: Do you know your saint schools from state schools? Your legendary coaches from your little brothers? Find out if you're in the Final Four — or didn't even get seeded.
item.content:encoded: Do you know your saint schools from state schools? Your legendary coaches from your little brothers? Find out if you're in the Final Four — or didn't even get seeded.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: COMIC: Still cringing about that awkward moment? Here's what to do about it
item.description: Experts demystify the science of awkwardness — and explain how to reduce the emotional intensity of mortifying flashbacks (like that one time you called your teacher "Mommy").
item.content:encoded: Experts demystify the science of awkwardness — and explain how to reduce the emotional intensity of mortifying flashbacks (like that one time you called your teacher "Mommy").
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: With Trump's crackdown on DEI, some women fear a path to good-paying jobs will close
item.description: Some fear a setback for women and people of color after President Trump revoked a 1965 executive order that required federal contractors to identify and address barriers to employment.
item.content:encoded:
Some fear a setback for women and people of color after President Trump revoked a 1965 executive order that required federal contractors to identify and address barriers to employment.

(Image credit: Amber N. Ford for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu
